title: News View :: The World On Arirang
text: Two of U.S. Air Force's most advanced airborne ground surveillance aircraft, the Joint-STARS, arrived on Sunday at the U.S. air base in Okinawa, Japan.While some speculate the U.S. has sent the aircraft to monitor North Korea amid its recent missile test, observers say the U.S. may have actually deployed the aircraft to check up on Chinese and Russian activities.This comes a matter of days after China unveiled its next-generation ICBM, which is said to be able to carry up to ten nuclear warheads, and can reach any part of the United States.
description: 한국을 대표하는 글로벌 방송! The World On Arirang!
